required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exploratory Study to Evaluate the Effects of the Probiotics L. Rhamnosus GR-1 and L. Reuteri RC-14
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Center Exploratory Study to Evaluate the Effects of the Probiotics L. Rhamnosus GR-1 and L. Reuteri RC-14 on Subjects With Intermediate Nugent Scores

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to determine whether L. rhamnosus GR-1 and L. reuteri RC-14 delivered via capsules to the vagina of post-menopausal women over a three day course of treatment can restore and maintain a lactobacilli-dominated microbiota. Exploratory analysis of microbial ecology, human microarrays and multiplex immunological assessments are included to characterize potential effects.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Nugent Score (arbitrary units) after treatment versus Change from baseline Nugent Score after placebo
primary_outcome.description: Determine whether L. rhamnosus GR-1 and L. reuteri RC-14 delivered via capsules to the vagina of post-menopausal women over a three day course of treatment can restore and maintain a lactobacilli-dominated microbiota for one week as measured by a decrease in the Nugent Scores from an intermediate score (4 - 6) at baseline to a normal score (0 - 3) following treatment compared to a placebo.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Untreated (Days 1, 5, & 15), Baseline Treatment I (Days15), Treatment I (Days 19 & 26), Baseline Treatment II (Day 36), Treatment II (Days 40 & 47)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in lactobacilli abundance before and after probiotic treatment and before and after placebo treatment. Lactobacilli abundance will be calculated as percentage of number of lactobacilli taxon divided by the total number of taxons.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Untreated (Days 1, 5, & 15), Baseline Treatment I (Days15), Treatment I (Days 19 & 26), Baseline Treatment II (Day 36), Treatment II (Days 40 & 47)
secondary_outcome.description: Gas chromatography-mass spectrometry will be used to determine changes in metabolites (such as lactate, glutamic acid, and others) before and after probiotic and placebo treatments.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Untreated (Days 1, 5, & 15), Baseline Treatment I (Days15), Treatment I (Days 19 & 26), Baseline Treatment II (Day 36), Treatment II (Days 40 & 47)
secondary_outcome.description: Multiplex ELISA based assay will be used to evaluate the modulation of cytokine and chemokine levels known regulate inflammation and host defense response before and after probiotic and placebo treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in global host gene expression
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Untreated (Days 1, 5, & 15), Baseline Treatment I (Days15), Treatment I (Days 19 & 26), Baseline Treatment II (Day 36), Treatment II (Days 40 & 47)
secondary_outcome.description: Microarray analysis using GeneChip Human 2.0 ST array will be used to measure gene expression changes (by mRNA analysis) to determine whether there are differences in gene regulation between probiotic, placebo, and no treatment conditions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Untreated (Days 1, 5, & 15), Baseline Treatment I (Days15), Treatment I (Days 19 & 26), Baseline Treatment II (Day 36), Treatment II (Days 40 & 47)
secondary_outcome.description: Symptom analysis to evaluate whether probiotic treatment is associated with symptom relief.

intervention.description: L. rhamnosus GR-1 and L. reuteri RC-14 capsules manufactured by Chr. Hansen
Placebo Comparator capsules, identical in appearance to the active product; 98% Gelatin with no L. rhamnosus GR-1 and L. reuteri RC- 14.
